item.title: A resolution expressing support for recognizing September 20 as National Service Dog Day.

latestAction.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent. (text: CR S4606-4607)

item.title: Expressing support for recognizing September 20 as National Service Dog Day.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6382; text: CR S6376)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

cdata.text: This resolution recognizes September 20 as National Service Dog Day to raise awareness of the positive impact service dogs have on individuals with disabilities.
This resolution recognizes September 20 as National Service Dog Day to raise awareness of the positive impact service dogs have on individuals with disabilities.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
